dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 1001 IH: Energy Freedom and Economic Prosperity Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Pompeo (for himself, Mr. Jones, Mr. Ribble, Mr. DeSantis, and Mr. Amash) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to terminate certain energy tax subsidies and lower the corporate income tax rate.

section.header: Short title; table of contents; etc

subsection.text: This Act may be cited as the Energy Freedom and Economic Prosperity Act.

Except as otherwise expressly provided, whenever in this Act an amendment or repeal is expressed in terms of an amendment to, or repeal of, a section or other provision, the reference shall be considered to be made to a section or other provision of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.
The table of contents for this Act is as follows:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 1. Short title; table of contents; etc.
Title I—Repeal of energy tax subsidies
Sec. 101. Repeal of credit for alcohol fuel, biodiesel, and alternative fuel mixtures.
Sec. 102. Early termination of credit for qualified fuel cell motor vehicles.
Sec. 103. Early termination of new qualified plug-in electric drive motor vehicles.
Sec. 104. Repeal of alternative fuel vehicle refueling property credit.
Sec. 105. Repeal of credit for alcohol used as fuel.
Sec. 106. Repeal of credit for biodiesel and renewable diesel used as fuel.
Sec. 107. Repeal of enhanced oil recovery credit.
Sec. 108. Termination of credit for electricity produced from certain renewable resources.
Sec. 109. Repeal of credit for producing oil and gas from marginal wells.
Sec. 110. Termination of credit for production from advanced nuclear power facilities.
Sec. 111. Repeal of credit for carbon dioxide sequestration.
Sec. 113. Repeal of qualifying advanced coal project.
Sec. 114. Repeal of qualifying gasification project credit.
Title II—Reduction of corporate income tax rate
Sec. 201. Corporate income tax rate reduced.

section.header: Repeal of credit for alcohol fuel, biodiesel, and alternative fuel mixtures

subsection.text: Section 6426 is repealed.

paragraph.text: Section 4101(a)(1) is amended by striking or alcohol (as defined in section 6426(b)(4)(A).
Section 4104(a)(2) is amended by striking 6426, or 6427(e).
Section 6427 is amended by striking subsection (e).
Section 7704(d)(1)(E) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by inserting (as in effect on the day before the date of the enactment of the Energy Freedom and Economic Prosperity Act) after of section 6426, and
by inserting (as so in effect) after section 6426(b)(4)(A).

paragraph.text: Section 9503(b)(1) is amended by striking the second sentence.

subsection.text: The table of sections for subchapter B of chapter 65 is amended by striking the item relating to section 6426.
The amendments made by this section shall apply with respect to fuel sold and used after December 31, 2014.

section.header: Early termination of credit for qualified fuel cell motor vehicles

subsection.text: Section 30B is repealed.

paragraph.text: Section 38(b) is amended by striking paragraph (25).
Section 1016(a) is amended by striking paragraph (35) and by redesignating paragraphs (36) and (37) as paragraphs (35) and (36), respectively.
Section 6501(m) is amended by striking 30B(h)(9),.

subsection.text: The table of sections for subpart B of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 is amended by striking the item relating to section 30B.
The amendments made by this section shall take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Early termination of new qualified plug-in electric drive motor vehicles

subsection.text: Section 30D is repealed.
The amendment made by this section shall apply to vehicles placed in service after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Repeal of alternative fuel vehicle refueling property credit

subsection.text: Section 30C is repealed.

paragraph.text: Section 38(b) is amended by striking paragraph (26).
Section 55(c)(3) is amended by striking sections 30C(d)(2) and and inserting section.
Section 1016(a), as amended by this Act, is amended by striking paragraph (35), by inserting and at the end of paragraph (34), and by redesignating paragraph (36) as paragraph (35).
Section 6501(m), as amended by this Act, is amended by striking 30C(e)(5),.

subsection.text: The table of sections for subpart B of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 is amended by striking the item relating to section 30C.
The amendments made by this section shall take effect on the date of the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Repeal of credit for alcohol used as fuel

subsection.text: Section 40 is repealed.

paragraph.text: Section 38(b) is amended by striking paragraph (3).
Section 196(c) is amended by striking paragraph (3) and by redesignating paragraphs (4) through (14) as paragraphs (3) through (13), respectively.
Section 4101(a)(1), as amended by this Act, is amended by striking , and every person producing cellulosic biofuel (as defined in section 40(b)(6)(E)).
Section 4104(a)(1) is amended by striking , 40,.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to fuel sold or used after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Repeal of credit for biodiesel and renewable diesel used as fuel

subsection.text: Section 40A is repealed.

paragraph.text: Section 38(b) is amended by striking paragraph (17).
Section 87 is repealed.
Section 196(c), as amended by section 105 of this Act, is amended by striking paragraph (11) and by redesignating paragraphs (11), (12), and (13) as paragraphs (10), (11), and (12), respectively.
Section 4101(a)(1) is amended by striking , every person producing or importing biodiesel (as defined in section 40A(d)(1).
Section 4104(a)(1) is amended by striking and 40A.
Section 7704(d)(1)(E) is amended by inserting (as so in effect) after section 40A(d)(1).

subsection.text: The table of sections for subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 is amended by striking the item relating to section 40A.
The amendments made by this section shall apply to fuel produced, and sold or used, after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Repeal of enhanced oil recovery credit

subsection.text: Section 43 is repealed.

paragraph.text: Section 38(b) is amended by striking paragraph (6).
Section 45Q(d)(4) is amended by inserting (as in effect on the day before the date of the enactment of the Energy Freedom and Economic Prosperity Act) after section 43(c)(2).
Section 196(c), as amended by sections 105 and 106 of this Act, is amended by striking paragraph (5) and by redesignating paragraphs (6) through (12) as paragraphs (5) through (11), respectively.

subsection.text: The table of sections for subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 is amended by striking the item relating to section 43.
The amendments made by this section shall apply to costs paid or incurred after December 31, 2014.

section.header: Termination of credit for electricity produced from certain renewable resources

subsection.text: Section 45 is repealed.
The table of sections for subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 is amended by striking the item relating to section 45.
The amendments made by this section shall apply to property placed in service after December 31, 2014.

section.header: Repeal of credit for producing oil and gas from marginal wells

subsection.text: Section 45I is repealed.
Section 38(b) is amended by striking paragraph (19).
The table of sections for subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 is amended by striking the item relating to section 45I.
The amendments made by this section shall apply to production in taxable years beginning after December 31, 2014.

section.header: Termination of credit for production from advanced nuclear power facilities

subsection.text: Section 45J(d)(1)(B) is amended by striking January 1, 2021 and inserting January 1, 2017.
The amendment made by this section shall apply to property placed in service after December 31, 2016.

section.header: Repeal of credit for carbon dioxide sequestration

subsection.text: Section 45Q is repealed.
Section 38(b) is amended by striking paragraph (34).
The table of sections for subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 is amended by striking the item relating to section 45Q.
The amendments made by this section shall apply to carbon dioxide captured after December 31, 2014.
Section 48 is repealed.
The table of sections for subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 is amended by striking the item relating to section 48.
The amendments made by this section shall apply to property placed in service after December 31, 2016.

section.header: Repeal of qualifying advanced coal project

subsection.text: Section 48A is repealed.

paragraph.text: Section 38(b) is amended by striking paragraph (10).
Section 46 is amended by striking paragraph (3) and by redesignating paragraphs (4), (5), and (6) as paragraphs (3), (4), and (5), respectively.

subsection.text: The table of sections for subpart E of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 is amended by striking the item relating to section 48A.
The amendments made by this section shall apply to property placed in service after December 31, 2014.

section.header: Repeal of qualifying gasification project credit

subsection.text: Section 48B is repealed.
Section 46, as amended by this Act, is amended by striking paragraph (3) and by redesignating paragraphs (4) and (5) as paragraphs (3) and (4), respectively.
The table of sections for subpart E of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 is amended by striking the item relating to section 48B.
The amendments made by this section shall apply to property placed in service after December 31, 2014.

title.header: Reduction of corporate income tax rate

subsection.text: Not later than 1 year after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of the Treasury shall prescribe a rate of tax in lieu of the rates under paragraphs (1) and (2) of section 11(b), section 1201(a), and paragraphs (1), (2), and (6) of section 1445(e) to such a flat rate as the Secretary estimates would result in—

paragraph.text: a decrease in revenue to the Treasury for taxable years beginning during the 10-year period beginning on the date of the enactment of this Act, equal to
the increase in revenue for such taxable years by reason of the amendments made by title I of this Act.

subsection.text: The rate prescribed by the Secretary under subsection (a) shall apply to taxable years beginning more than 1 year after the date of the enactment of this Act.
